pullRequest.title: Feat: enable having a parent theme
pullRequest.bodyText:
It is now possible to extend a parent application
theme. This means adding the key "parent" with
the value of the target theme and then this will
be used with the current theme.
Fixes #9587

nodes.bodyText:
How about a third test that css from the parent theme can be overwritten by the child? (e.g. having Lumo as parent and customizing a specific color)
Edit: Looks like there is a typo in test above as well; you probably mean 'Margin from theme should be applied.'
As this will now recursively also do things for all parent themes, maybe that could be clarified here

Non-blocking: Just a thought that it would probably be a good idea to have an util method that "gets the generated file for a given theme name" that is reused in all places, but that refactoring can be done later if needed

commit.message:
Feat: enable having a parent theme

It is now possible to extend a parent application
theme. This means adding the key "parent" with
the value of the target theme and then this will
be used with the current theme.

Fixes #9587
